channel.title: [SOLVED]DNS of VPN for Workstation
channel.description:
Following the guide [here](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tunnels/Connecting_to_Tor_before_a_VPN) I am updating my resolv.conf. Upon typing sudo route I get:
Destination Gateway Genmask Flags Metric Ref Use Iface default gateway 0.0.0.0 UG 50 0 0 tun1 default gateway 0.0.0.0 UG 100 0 0 enp3s0 10.8.0.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 50 0 0 tun1 unassigned.reve gateway 255.255.255.255 UGH 100 0 0 enp3s0 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 100 0 0 enp3s0 192.168.124.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 0 0 0 virbr0
Do I need my VPN's DNS to configure my VPN setup? I contacted my VPN and they said they don't use a DNS as far as they know, but maybe they or I are misunderstanding something about Whonix. Do I even need to configure the DNS if my VPN provider doesn't use it?
Solved, looks like it's not necessary to do anything to the resolv.conf

item.title: [SOLVED]DNS of VPN for Workstation
item.dc:creator: Grey
item.description:
Following the guide here I am updating my resolv.conf.
Upon typing sudo route I get:

Destination Gateway Genmask Flags Metric Ref Use Iface
default gateway 0.0.0.0 UG 50 0 0 tun1
default gateway 0.0.0.0 UG 100 0 0 enp3s0
10.8.0.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 50 0 0 tun1
unassigned.reve gateway 255.255.255.255 UGH 100 0 0 enp3s0
192.168.1.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 100 0 0 enp3s0
192.168.124.0 0.0.0.0 255.255.255.0 U 0 0 0 virbr0

Do I need my VPN’s DNS to configure my VPN setup? I contacted my VPN and they said they don’t use a DNS as far as they know, but maybe they or I are misunderstanding something about Whonix. Do I even need to configure the DNS if my VPN provider doesn’t use it?

Solved, looks like it’s not necessary to do anything to the resolv.conf

Read full topic
